diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Inherited antithrombin deficiency for Case 1; Pernicious anemia with vitamin B12 deficiency and incipient hypothyroidism from Hashimoto thyroiditis for Case 2.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Case 1: Reduced plasma antithrombin activity and a heterozygous mutation consistent with inherited antithrombin deficiency. Case 2: Increased thyroid-stimulating hormone and thyroid peroxidase antibodies indicating Hashimoto thyroiditis, and high homocysteine levels and methylmalonic acid, confirming vitamin B12 deficiency due to pernicious anemia.
